oracle.nosql.driver.idcs

Class DefaultAccessTokenProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.nosql.driver.idcs.AccessTokenProvider
      • oracle.nosql.driver.idcs.DefaultAccessTokenProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthorizationProvider

    public class DefaultAccessTokenProvider
extends AccessTokenProvider
    An instance of AccessTokenProvider that acquires access tokens from Oracle Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) using information provided by a configured CredentialsProvider. By default the PropertiesCredentialsProvider is used.

    This class requires tenant-specific information in order to properly communicate with IDCS using the credential information:

    1. An entitlement id. This is generated by Oracle during account creation.
    2. A tenant-specific URL used to communicate with IDCS
    The entitlement id can be found using the IDCS admin console. After logging into the IDCS admin console, choose Applications from the button on the top left. Find the Application named ANDC, enter the Resources tab in the Configuration. There is a field called primary audience, the entitlement id parameter is the value of "urn:opc:andc:entitlementid", which is treated as a string. For example if your primary audience is "urn:opc:andc:entitlementid=123456789" then the parameter is "123456789"

    The tenant-specific IDCS URL is the IDCS host assigned to the tenant. After logging into the IDCS admin console, copy the host of the IDCS admin console URL. For example, the format of the admin console URL is "https://{tenantId}.identity.oraclecloud.com/ui/v1/adminconsole". The "https://{tenantId}.identity.oraclecloud.com" portion is the required parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultAccessTokenProvider

        public DefaultAccessTokenProvider()
        Constructs a default access token provider with an IDCS properties file from the default path ~/.andc/idcs.props. Provider can fetch IDCS URL, entitlement ID and path of credentials file from the properties file. The property name and value must be written in the form of 
        key=value
        It parses each line of the specified file, extracting properties. Leading and trailing whitespace in key and value are ignored.

        These property names are recognized and are case-sensitive:

      • idcs_url
      • entitlement_id
      • creds_file
        • Only credentials file is optional, its default is ~/.andc/credentials.

  • DefaultAccessTokenProvider

    public DefaultAccessTokenProvider(java.lang.String idcsPropsFile)
    Constructs a default access token provider with an IDCS properties file. Provider can fetch IDCS URL, entitlement ID and path of credentials file from the properties file. The property name and value must be written in the form of 
    key=value
    It parses each line of the specified file, extracting properties. Leading and trailing whitespace in key and value are ignored.

    These property names are recognized and are case-sensitive:

  • idcs_url
  • entitlement_id
  • creds_file
    • Only credentials file is optional, its default is ~/.andc/credentials.

  • DefaultAccessTokenProvider

    public DefaultAccessTokenProvider(java.lang.String entitlementId,
                                  java.lang.String idcsURL)
    Constructs a default access token provider disabling use of refresh tokens.
    Parameters:
    entitlementId - service entitlement ID, which can be found from the primary audience of the application named ANDC from IDCS.
    idcsURL - an IDCS URL, provided by IDCS

  • DefaultAccessTokenProvider

    public DefaultAccessTokenProvider(java.lang.String entitlementId,
                                  java.lang.String idcsURL,
                                  boolean useRefreshToken)
    Constructs a default access token provider.
    Parameters:
    entitlementId - service entitlement ID, which can be found from the primary audience of the application named ANDC from IDCS.
    idcsURL - an IDCS URL, provided by IDCS
    useRefreshToken - if true, enable using refresh tokens to acquire access tokens. Note that it only can be used to acquire service access token. By default, refresh token is disabled, which must be enabled by changing "Is Refresh Token Allowed" in Resources tab in Configuration of application ANDC from IDCS admin console.

  • DefaultAccessTokenProvider

    public DefaultAccessTokenProvider(java.lang.String entitlementId,
                                  java.lang.String idcsURL,
                                  boolean useRefreshToken,
                                  CredentialsProvider credsProvider,
                                  int timeoutMs,
                                  int cacheDurationSeconds)
    Construct a default access token provider with a non-default CredentialsProvider
    Parameters:
    entitlementId - service entitlement ID, which can be found from the primary audience of the application named ANDC from IDCS
    idcsURL - an IDCS URL, provided by IDCS
    useRefreshToken - if true, enable using refresh tokens to acquire access tokens. Note that it only can be used to acquire service access token. By default, refresh token is disabled, which must be enabled by changing "Is Refresh Token Allowed" in Resources tab in Configuration of application ANDC from IDCS admin console.
    credsProvider - a credentials provider
    timeoutMs - the access token acquisition request timeout in milliseconds
    cacheDurationSeconds - the amount of time the access tokens are cached in the provider, in seconds

    • getAccountAccessToken

      public java.lang.String getAccountAccessToken()
      Description copied from class: AccessTokenProvider
      Returns an account AT to be used for one of the following operations:
      1. Create table
      2. Drop table
      3. Alter table limits
      4. List tables

      Oracle Cloud creates an OAuth resource named "PSMApp-cacct-{id}" when the cloud account is created. Note that id will be dynamically generated for each account by Oracle Cloud. This method must return an AT with audience in the account OAuth resource, and scope /paas/core/api/*. Note that currently this OAuth resource only allows Resource Owner Grant type to acquire the access token. In other words, the client id and secret pair along with user name and password need to be present in the token acquisition payload.

      Specified by:
      getAccountAccessToken in class AccessTokenProvider
      Returns:
      an account access token.

    • getServiceAccessToken

      public java.lang.String getServiceAccessToken()
      Description copied from class: AccessTokenProvider
      Returns an AT to be used for service operations which is all data operations and generally any operation that is not an account operations.
      Specified by:
      getServiceAccessToken in class AccessTokenProvider
      Returns:
      a service access token.
